  • GSEA NCG
  • View page source

GSEA NCG

Perform GSE analysis on Network of Cancer Genes

URL:

Example

This wrapper can be used in the following way:

rule test_gseNCG:
    input:
        rds = "geneList.RDS"
    output:
        rds = "gseNCG.RDS",
        tsv = "gseNCG.tsv"
    params:
        gseNCG_extra = "pvalueCutoff  = 1, pAdjustMethod = 'BH', by = 'DOSE'"
    wrapper:
        "0.79.0-1266-g4f9e1419f/bio/clusterProfiler/gseNCG"

Note that input, output and log file paths can be chosen freely.

When running with

snakemake --use-conda

the software dependencies will be automatically deployed into an isolated environment before execution.

Software dependencies

  • bioconda:bioconductor-clusterprofiler=3.14.0

  • bioconda:bioconductor-org.hs.eg.db=3.10.0

  • bioconda:bioconductor-dose=3.12.0

Input/Output

Input:

  • A geneList object as RDS

Output:

  • A RDS object containing the GSEA based on NCG

  • A TSV file containing the GSEA based on NCG

Notes

The geneList object if described in the DESeq2_to_geneList wrapper

Human only

Parameters:

  • gseNCG_extra: Extra parameters for gseNCG, besides “gene”, “readable”, and “verbose”

Authors

  • Thibault Dayris

Code

#!/usr/bin/R

# This script takes a geneList object and performs
# an GSEA based on NCG

# __author__ = "Thibault Dayris"
# __copyright__ = "Copyright 2020, Thibault Dayris"
# __email__ = "thibault.dayris@gustaveroussy.fr"
# __license__ = "MIT"

# Sink the stderr and stdout to the snakemake log file
# https://stackoverflow.com/a/48173272
log.file<-file(snakemake@log[[1]],open="wt");
base::sink(log.file);
base::sink(log.file,type="message");

# Perform gene enrichment
base::library(package = "DOSE", quietly = TRUE);
base::library(package = "clusterProfiler", quietly = TRUE);
# Loading databases
base::library(package = "org.Hs.eg.db", quietly = TRUE);

# Loading input dataset
geneList <- base::readRDS(
  file = snakemake@input[["rds"]]
);

extra <- "geneList, verbose = TRUE";
if ("gseNCG_extra" %in% base::names(snakemake@params)) {
  extra <- base::paste(
    extra,
    snakemake@params[["gseNCG_extra"]],
    sep = ", "
  )
}

command <- base::paste0(
  "DOSE::gseNCG(",
  extra,
  ")"
);
base::message("Libraries and datasets loaded");
base::message(command);

# Performing DOSE enrichment
gse_ncg <- base::eval(
  base::parse(
    text = command
  )
);
base::message("GSEA done");

gse_ncg <- DOSE::setReadable(
    x = gse_ncg,
    OrgDb = org.Hs.eg.db,
    keyType = "ENTREZID"
);

# Saving results
base::saveRDS(
  obj = gse_ncg,
  file = snakemake@output[["rds"]]
);

utils::write.table(
  x = gse_ncg,
  file = snakemake@output[["tsv"]]
);

# Proper syntax to close the connection for the log file
# but could be optional for Snakemake wrapper
base::sink(type="message");
base::sink();
